title: System Owner and User Discovery
descrption: WindowsAdversaries may attempt to identify the primary user, currently logged in user, set of users that commonly uses a system, or whether a user is actively using the system. They may do this, for example, by retrieving account usernames or by using Credential Dumping. The information may be collected in a number of different ways using other Discovery techniques, because user and username details are prevalent throughout a system and include running process ownership, file/directory ownership, session information, and system logs. Adversaries may use the information from System Owner/User Discovery during automated discovery to shape follow-on behaviors, including whether or not the adversary fully infects the target and/or attempts specific actions.MacOn Mac, the currently logged in user can be identified with users,w, and who.LinuxOn Linux, the currently logged in user can be identified with w and who.
Data Sources: File monitoring, Process monitoring, Process command-line parameters

related.Name: Agent Tesla
related.Description: Agent Tesla collects the username from the victim’s machine.[29][30]

related.Name: Agent.btz
related.Description: Agent.btz obtains the victim username and saves it to a file.[42]

related.Name: APT19
related.Description: APT19 used an HTTP malware variant and a Port 22 malware variant to collect the victim’s username.[78]

related.Name: APT3
related.Description: An APT3 downloader uses the Windows command "cmd.exe" /C whoami to verify that it is running with the elevated privileges of "System."[86]

related.Name: APT32
related.Description: APT32 collected the victim's username and executed the whoami command on the victim's machine.[72][73]

related.Name: APT37
related.Description: APT37 identifies the victim username.[74]

related.Name: APT39
related.Description: APT39 used Remexi to collect usernames from the system.[91]

related.Name: APT41
related.Description: APT41 used the WMIEXEC utility to execute whoami commands on remote machines.[94]

related.Name: Azorult
related.Description: Azorult can collect the username from the victim’s machine.[37]

related.Name: BabyShark
related.Description: BabyShark has executed the whoami command.[71]

related.Name: Backdoor.Oldrea
related.Description: Backdoor.Oldrea collects the current username from the victim.[18]

related.Name: BISCUIT
related.Description: BISCUIT has a command to gather the username from the system.[21]

related.Name: Cannon
related.Description: Cannon can gather the username from the system.[36]

related.Name: Cardinal RAT
related.Description: Cardinal RAT can collect the username from a victim machine.[40]

related.Name: DarkComet
related.Description: DarkComet gathers the username from the victim’s machine.[9]

related.Name: Denis
related.Description: Denis collects the username from the victim’s machine.[38]

related.Name: Derusbi
related.Description: A Linux version of Derusbi checks if the victim user ID is anything other than zero (normally used for root), and the malware will not execute if it does not have root privileges. Derusbi also gathers the username of the victim.[6]

related.Name: DownPaper
related.Description: DownPaper collects the victim username and sends it to the C2 server.[25]

related.Name: Dragonfly 2.0
related.Description: Dragonfly 2.0 used the command query user on victim hosts.[90]

related.Name: Epic
related.Description: Epic collects the user name from the victim’s machine.[43]

related.Name: Felismus
related.Description: Felismus collects the current username and sends it to the C2 server.[32]

related.Name: FELIXROOT
related.Description: FELIXROOT collects the username from the victim’s machine.[26][27]

related.Name: FIN10
related.Description: FIN10 has used Meterpreter to enumerate users on remote systems.[77]

related.Name: FlawedAmmyy
related.Description: FlawedAmmyy enumerates the current user during the initial infection.[65]

related.Name: Gamaredon Group
related.Description: A Gamaredon Group file stealer can gather the victim's username to send to a C2 server.[87]

related.Name: Gazer
related.Description: Gazer obtains the current user's security identifier.[10]

related.Name: Gold Dragon
related.Description: Gold Dragon collects the endpoint victim's username and uses it as a basis for downloading additional components from the C2 server.[5]

related.Name: GravityRAT
related.Description: GravityRAT collects the victim username along with other account information (account type, description, full name, SID and status).[20]

related.Name: HAPPYWORK
related.Description: can collect the victim user name.[4]

related.Name: HAWKBALL
related.Description: HAWKBALL can collect the user name of the system.[69]

related.Name: InvisiMole
related.Description: InvisiMole lists local users and session information.[45]

related.Name: Ixeshe
related.Description: Ixeshe collects the username from the victim’s machine.[68]

related.Name: JPIN
related.Description: JPIN can obtain the victim user name.[41]

related.Name: Kazuar
related.Description: Kazuar gathers information on users.[7]

related.Name: Koadic
related.Description: Koadic can identify logged in users across the domain and views user sessions.[2]

related.Name: Komplex
related.Description: The OsInfo function in Komplex collects the current running username.[59]

related.Name: KONNI
related.Description: KONNI can collect the username from the victim’s machine.[12]

related.Name: Kwampirs
related.Description: Kwampirs collects registered owner details by using the commands systeminfo and net config workstation.[33]

related.Name: Lazarus Group
related.Description: Various Lazarus Group malware enumerates logged-on users.[79][80][81][82][83]

related.Name: Linux Rabbit
related.Description: Linux Rabbit opens a socket on port 22 and if it receives a response it attempts to obtain the machine's hostname and Top-Level Domain.[62]

related.Name: Magic Hound
related.Description: Magic Hound malware has obtained the victim username and sent it to the C2 server.[84]

related.Name: Micropsia
related.Description: Micropsia collects the username from the victim’s machine.[14]

related.Name: MirageFox
related.Description: MirageFox can gather the username from the victim’s machine.[47]

related.Name: Mis-Type
related.Description: Mis-Type runs tests to determine the privilege level of the compromised user.[11]

related.Name: MoonWind
related.Description: MoonWind obtains the victim username.[50]

related.Name: More_eggs
related.Description: More_eggs has the capability to gather the username from the victim's machine.[53][54]

related.Name: Mosquito
related.Description: Mosquito runs whoami on the victim’s machine.[24]

related.Name: MuddyWater
related.Description: MuddyWater has used malware that can collect the victim’s username.[76]

related.Name: NanHaiShu
related.Description: NanHaiShu collects the username from the victim.[19]

related.Name: NDiskMonitor
related.Description: NDiskMonitor obtains the victim username and encrypts the information to send over its C2 channel.[28]

related.Name: njRAT
related.Description: njRAT enumerates the current user during the initial infection.[67]

related.Name: NOKKI
related.Description: NOKKI can collect the username from the victim’s machine.[44]

related.Name: Octopus
related.Description: Octopus collects the username from the victim’s machine.[60]

related.Name: OilRig
related.Description: OilRig has run whoami on a victim.[88][89]

related.Name: Patchwork
related.Description: Patchwork collected the victim username and whether it was running as admin, then sent the information to its C2 server.[85][28]

related.Name: PowerDuke
related.Description: PowerDuke has commands to get the current user's name and SID.[39]

related.Name: POWRUNER
related.Description: POWRUNER may collect information about the currently logged in user by running whoami on a victim.[23]

related.Name: Prikormka
related.Description: A module in Prikormka collects information from the victim about the current user name.[51]

related.Name: Pupy
related.Description: Pupy can enumerate local information for Linux hosts and find currently logged on users for Windows hosts.[1]

related.Name: QUADAGENT
related.Description: QUADAGENT gathers the victim username.[57]

related.Name: RATANKBA
related.Description: RATANKBA runs the whoami and query user commands.[16]

related.Name: Reaver
related.Description: Reaver collects the victim's username.[17]

related.Name: RedLeaves
related.Description: RedLeaves can obtain information about the logged on user both locally and for Remote Desktop sessions.[3]

related.Name: Remsec
related.Description: Remsec can obtain information about the current user.[31]

related.Name: Revenge RAT
related.Description: Revenge RAT gathers the username from the system.[64]

related.Name: RGDoor
related.Description: RGDoor executes the whoami on the victim’s machine.[48]

related.Name: RogueRobin
related.Description: RogueRobin collects the victim’s username and whether that user is an admin.[55]

related.Name: RTM
related.Description: RTM can obtain the victim username and permissions.[46]

related.Name: ServHelper
related.Description: ServHelper will attempt to enumerate the username of the victim.[66]

related.Name: Soft Cell
related.Description: Soft Cell used whoami and query user to obtain information about the victim user.[93]

related.Name: SpeakUp
related.Description: SpeakUp uses the whoami command.[63]

related.Name: SslMM
related.Description: SslMM sends the logged-on username to its hard-coded C2.[35]

related.Name: Stealth Falcon
related.Description: Stealth Falcon malware gathers the registered user and primary owner name via WMI.[75]

related.Name: SynAck
related.Description: SynAck gathers user names from infected hosts.[52]

related.Name: Sys10
related.Description: Sys10 collects the account name of the logged-in user and sends it to the C2.[35]

related.Name: T9000
related.Description: T9000 gathers and beacons the username of the logged in account during installation. It will also gather the username of running processes to determine if it is running as SYSTEM.[13]

related.Name: Tropic Trooper
related.Description: Tropic Trooper used letmein to scan for saved usernames on the target system.[92]

related.Name: Unknown Logger
related.Description: Unknown Logger can obtain information about the victim usernames.[8]

related.Name: UPPERCUT
related.Description: UPPERCUT has the capability to collect the current logged on user’s username from a machine.[22]

related.Name: VERMIN
related.Description: VERMIN gathers the username from the victim’s machine.[58]

related.Name: WINDSHIELD
related.Description: WINDSHIELD can gather the victim user name.[56]

related.Name: WINERACK
related.Description: WINERACK can gather information on the victim username.[4]

related.Name: WinMM
related.Description: WinMM uses NetUser-GetInfo to identify that it is running under an "Admin" account on the local system.[35]

related.Name: XAgentOSX
related.Description: XAgentOSX contains the getInfoOSX function to return the OS X version as well as the current user.[49]

related.Name: yty
related.Description: yty collects the victim’s username.[15]

related.Name: Zebrocy
related.Description: Zebrocy gets the username from the system.[61]

related.Name: zwShell
related.Description: zwShell can obtain the name of the logged-in user on the victim.[34]

related.Name: ZxShell
related.Description: ZxShell can collect the owner and organization information from the target workstation. [70]
